intro: Lasiandra imperatoris, commonly known as the imperial lasiandra, is a flowering plant native to the island of Socotra. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. The plant has woody stems and is adapted to the arid conditions of its native habitat. It is known for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens. Lasiandra imperatoris plays a role in the local ecosystem by providing nectar for pollinators.
